intro: Schizoica laevis, commonly known as the smooth schizoica, is a flowering plant native to specific regions in South America. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes plants commonly referred to as buckwheats. The plant is characterized by its smooth, glabrous leaves and clusters of small, greenish-white flowers. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and horticultural studies.
